educational_objective: Diagnose basic calcium phosphate deposition involving the shoulder.
question_text: A 72-year-old woman is evaluated for chronic right shoulder pain associated with a large effusion.A radiograph of the right shoulder is shown.
question_stem: Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?
critique: The most likely diagnosis is basic calcium phosphate (BCP) deposition (Option A), which can be periarticular (calcific periarthritis) and intra-articular. This patient has Milwaukee shoulder, a classic manifestation of intra-articular BCP deposition. Milwaukee shoulder is a destructive, chronic arthropathy often associated with a large, noninflammatory effusion and commonly occurring in older women. This patient's radiograph demonstrates glenohumeral joint degradation and a “high-riding” humeral head.
